snippet: In a blow to national Republican leaders, State Assemblyman Tom J. Bordonaro, a conservative maverick, edged the chosen candidate of his party's establishment in a special Congressional primary on Tuesday and will face the widow of Representative ...
lead_paragraph: In a blow to national Republican leaders, State Assemblyman Tom J. Bordonaro, a conservative maverick, edged the chosen candidate of his party's establishment in a special Congressional primary on Tuesday and will face the widow of Representative Walter Capps in a runoff to fill the seat left vacant by Mr. Capps's death. The contest, the first Congressional election of 1998, has drawn national interest and independent spending by outside groups as a bellwether in the battle to control Congress.
abstract: Assemblyman Tom J Bordonaro, conservative Republican maverick, wins runoff slot in special primary for Congressional seat from California left vacant by death of Rep Walter Capps; defeats Assemblyman Brooks Firestone, who was recruited by national Republican leaders to seek seat; will face Capps' widow, Lois Capps, Democrat, who won most votes in primary (M)

headline.main: Widow to Face G.O.P. Maverick in House Runoff
